definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
chain/cable (unit of length: 100 fathoms, about 185 m)/chain (unit of length: 66 feet, about 20 m)/to chain/to enchain

sentences.english: Not all products might have the same route through the supply chain.
sentences.chinese: 並非所有產品都沿着相同的路徑通過供應鏈。

sentences.english: Revenue and Margin Driver Suppliers take actions that go much further than improving supply chain efficiencies, reactively or proactively.
sentences.chinese: 收入和邊際利潤驅動廠商對供應鏈的變革更進一步。

sentences.english: It is very difficult to become part of Mandalay's supply chain.
sentences.chinese: 想要擠進M公司供應鏈的窄門，是非常困難的一件事。

sentences.english: They point to an example that is well known to supply-chain mavens.
sentences.chinese: 一個很切題的例子許多供應鏈專家都知道。

sentences.english: These supply chain problems can be summarized as a lack of visibility.
sentences.chinese: 這些供應鏈問題可以總結爲缺乏可見性。

sentences.english: It can apply to whole supply chains and distribution networks.
sentences.chinese: 它各一運用在整個供應鏈和分銷網絡中。

sentences.english: Then we generalized the strenth of China in connecting with the international supply chain.
sentences.chinese: 建立國際化供應鏈成爲他們向國際化進軍的必然選擇。

sentences.english: Constructs the Tangshan medicine station above this foundation to supply the chain to transform the practice.
sentences.chinese: 在此基礎之上構建唐山醫藥站供應鏈變革實踐。

sentences.english: Third, based on multi-project procurement model, management program was proposed.
sentences.chinese: 再次，對基於供應鏈的採購管理模式進行方案設計。

sentences.english: This paper focuses on overcoming the supply chain issues associated with human resources.
sentences.chinese: 這篇文章關注於克服供應鏈聯合人力資源的問題。

sentences.english: Internet-driven electronic marketplace (IEMP) can provide an effective platform to select the right partners.
sentences.chinese: 電子市場和供應鏈夥伴選擇是兩個不同的概念。

sentences.english: A genetic algorithm for computing the mixed-integer programming model of supply chain is designed, and a milk retailing problem is simulated.
sentences.chinese: 對於服務銷售中的奶品零售問題進行了供應鏈仿真。

sentences.english: This is the interruption of the global supply chain. This is our problem.
sentences.chinese: 海盜會中斷全球的供應鏈，這是我們的問題。

sentences.english: The results provide some decisionmaking basis for agents in practical supply chains.
sentences.chinese: 研究結果爲實際供應鏈中的企業提供了決策依據。

sentences.english: Here is a comparison between the traditional supply chain and GNS.
sentences.chinese: 爲此，我們將傳統供應鏈與GNS作一比較。

sentences.english: Like Mr Lei, he pointed 10 to supply chain problems among other issues.
sentences.chinese: 與雷軍一樣，他提到了供應鏈問題以及其他問題。

definition: e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
industry chain (concept proposed by US scholar Michael Porter in 1985)
